intro: Adenocarpus complicatus nothosubsp. danielii, commonly known as the Daniel's complicated thornveld, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Adenocarpus. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. This nothosubspecies is likely a hybrid, exhibiting unique botanical traits that distinguish it from other members of the species.
